page.title: 10Home Life, Ships, 50 Yrs Ago
page.content: There were paddle steamers which were used for pleasure trips. One called the "United Service" travelled out to sea in the summer & during the winter was used as a mud dredger. Other pleasure boats took passengers from Gorleston to Great Yarmouth for the fare of 6d (2.5p.) Small boys would run along the shore trying to catch them up & when the journey had finished they held out their hands for money from the passenages. In the autumn there would be hundreds of steam herring drifters moored in either side of the river up to the hourbours mouth. The Gorleston lifeboat called the "Elizabeth Simpson" saved over 500 lives & never capsized or lost any of her crew.
